resources.string:
\ Name: Deborah Ho 
 Email: ho.de@husky.neu.edu 
 Exchange student at NEU 
 School: Vrije Universiteit Amsterdam 
 Year: Senior 
 Major: Econometrics

\ Sudoku is a logic-based number placement puzzle. Starting with a partially completed 9x9 grid, the objective is to fill the grid so that each row, each column, and each of the 3x3 boxes (also called blocks) contains the digits 1 to 9 exactly once.

\This assignment would not be completed if it were not for the following sources: 
 
I have used the following code to implement the textbox on my app: 
http://www.simplecodestuffs.com/all-tutorials-2/create-and-edit-text-box/ 
 
The code for the bloom filter can be found here and all credits go to the authors of this code: 
https://github.com/MagnusS/Java-BloomFilter 
 
I would also like to acknowledge Dinesh Chandramohan and Juhi Paralkar for giving me ideas of how to implement the dictionary. The suggested ideas were to split the files and to implement a bloom filter. 
 
The mp3 of the beep can be downloaded from the following website, called Beep 7: 
http://www.soundjay.com/beep-sounds-1.html 
 
Finally, the icon for my app can be found here: 
http://www.stickersemoticon.com/fat-rabbit-farm-facebook-stickers/

\This assignment would not be completed if it were not for the following sources: 
 
The majority of my code is based on the Sudoku app described in the book 'Hello, Android' by Ed Burnette (3rd Edition). 
 
The code for the bloom filter that is also used in the dictionary, can be found here and all credits go to the authors of this code: 
https://github.com/MagnusS/Java-BloomFilter 
 
The code for the countdown timer and vibrating at the last five seconds can be found here: 
http://stackoverflow.com/questions/17620641/countdowntimer-in-minutes-and-seconds 
 
I would also like to acknowledge Dinesh Chandramohan for giving me tips on how to implement the idea I had for the main screen of the word game. 
 
Furthermore I would like to thank the students in the Mobile App Development course for their help on Piazza. 
 
The mp3 of the beep can be downloaded from the following website, called Beep 7: 
http://www.soundjay.com/beep-sounds-1.html 
 
The background music on the main screen is by Josh Gray called Classical, which can be downloaded here: 
http://www.last.fm/music/+free-music-downloads/instrumental+guitar 
 
The background music during the game is by Yiruma called Lord... Hold My Hand, and can be downloaded here: 
http://mp3skull.com/mp3/yiruma.html 
 
Finally, the icon for my app can be found here: 
http://www.stickersemoticon.com/fat-rabbit-farm-facebook-stickers/
This word game is based on the game Bananagrams. Make words that are connected with eachother and score as many points as you can in 90 seconds. The words should be horizontally or vertically lined.

\This assignment would not be completed if it were not for the following sources: 
 
The majority of my code is based on the GCMDemo described on the Android Developer website: 
http://developer.android.com/google/gcm/client.html 
 
To store data, I have used the following server: 
https://docs.google.com/document/d/166xN2mr8C1bXLPhgq3hLYN1hCWP28o5zhmKvvZvwUZA/edit 
 
To check if the phone is connected to the Internet, I have used the following code from StackOverflow: 
http://stackoverflow.com/questions/1560788/how-to-check-internet-access-on-android-inetaddress-never-timeouts 
 
I would also like to acknowledge Dinesh Chandramohan for giving me tips on how to implement the server and how to send messages between users. 
 
Finally, the icon for my app can be found here: 
http://www.stickersemoticon.com/fat-rabbit-farm-facebook-stickers/

\This assignment would not be completed if it were not for the following sources: 
 
The majority of my code is based on the GCMDemo described on the Android Developer website: 
http://developer.android.com/google/gcm/client.html 
 
To store data, I have used the following server: 
https://docs.google.com/document/d/166xN2mr8C1bXLPhgq3hLYN1hCWP28o5zhmKvvZvwUZA/edit 
 
To check if the phone is connected to the Internet, I have used the following code from StackOverflow: 
http://stackoverflow.com/questions/1560788/how-to-check-internet-access-on-android-inetaddress-never-timeouts 
 
To implement the listview in Android, I have used the following tutorial: 
http://www.vogella.com/tutorials/AndroidListView/article.html
